intro: Festania nivea, commonly known as the white festonia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, white flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional medicine by local communities. Festania nivea is also valued for its ornamental appeal due to its graceful appearance and unique floral structure.
